citations.narrative:
There is a large, jagged hole in the wood panel which lines the outside of a shelter for a sheep and three alpacas. Several
nails and screws with sharp points are protruding from the fence near the entry of the primary enclosure, within reach of
the animals.
-The primary enclosure for a tiger has overgrown tree limbs and vines entangled in a corner of the wire enclosure fence.
The top post in one corner of the enclosure fence is damaged and sagging. This reduces the height and integrity of the
enclosure fence in this area and must be repaired to ensure the tiger is safely contained.
-In the central big cat housing section, three enclosures have tree limbs entangled in the fencing which is causing
separation of some fence supports. A cougar pen in this area has a sagging wire roof with a tree limb on it. These trees
and branches must be cut and removed from the fencing to protect the integrity of the enclosures and help ensure the
cats are safely contained.
All facilities must be maintained in good condition and repair to protect the health and welfare of the animals.
Correct by 14 February 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
MICHAEL TYGART, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
There is a large, jagged hole in the wood panel which lines the outside of a shelter for a sheep and three alpacas. Several 
nails and screws with sharp points are protruding from the fence near the entry of the primary enclosure, within reach of 
the animals. 
-The primary enclosure for a tiger has overgrown tree limbs and vines entangled in a corner of the wire enclosure fence. 
The top post in one corner of the enclosure fence is damaged and sagging. This reduces the height and integrity of the 
enclosure fence in this area and must be repaired to ensure the tiger is safely contained. 
-In the central big cat housing section, three enclosures have tree limbs entangled in the fencing which is causing 
separation of some fence supports. A cougar pen in this area has a sagging wire roof with a tree limb on it. These trees 
and branches must be cut and removed from the fencing to protect the integrity of the enclosures and help ensure the 
cats are safely contained. 
All facilities must be maintained in good condition and repair to protect the health and welfare of the animals. 
Correct by 14 February 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
MICHAEL TYGART, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

species.scientific: Ara, Anodorhynchus, Primolius, Diopsittaca spp hybrid
